headline: Katie Hobbs refuses to say if abortion should be limited
author: NationalWatch
sentences:
(AP Photo/Ross D. Franklin, Pool)
OAN Newsroom
UPDATED 8:45 AM PT – Wednesday, April 6, 2022
Democrat candidate for Arizona Governor Katie Hobbs refused to give an answer about at what point in a pregnancy she would allow abortion to be banned.

And that’s something that needs to be discussed in the medical exam room, not by politicians.”
Hobbs’s comments come on the heels of Republican Governor Doug Ducey signing into law a bill which bans abortions in the state after 15-weeks.
Arizona Secretary of State Katie Hobbs looks over the Arizona Presidential Electoral Ballot from the members of Arizona’s Electoral College, Monday, Dec. 14, 2020, in Phoenix.
Instead of answering the question when asked if there should be a limit, Hobbs said that abortion is a right and her record speaks for itself.
She was pressed by the host again and she replied that it’s not up to her, just the woman and her doctor.
“Where do you draw the line and say okay, abortions after this point in time, no, it’s a no go.

MORE NEWS: Rep. Cawthorn Explains Basic Biology To Speaker Pelosi
Original Article Oann
While speaking to local media on Tuesday, Hobbs was pressed on her abortion stance.
Abortion is a personal decision between a woman and her family and her doctor.
“I mean, you know, if it’s not 15-weeks, is it 24-weeks?” she asked.
